name: Weather Dashboard
description: Open-source weather aggregation dashboard that combines data from multiple weather APIs to provide unified forecasts with historical trend analysis and severe weather alerts.
prompt_template: You are a weather data expert. Use the project documentation to understand the API aggregation architecture, data normalization patterns, and caching strategies. Help users understand forecast accuracy and suggest improvements to the weather data pipeline.

docs.content:
# Weather Dashboard Architecture

## Overview
The Weather Dashboard aggregates forecast data from three providers: OpenWeatherMap, WeatherAPI, and NOAA. Each provider has an adapter class that normalizes responses to our common WeatherDataPoint schema.

## Data Flow
1. Scheduler triggers fetch jobs every 30 minutes for active locations
2. Each provider adapter fetches and normalizes data independently
3. Merge engine combines forecasts using confidence-weighted averaging
4. Normalized data is cached in SQLite with TTL-based expiration
5. Frontend polls the REST API for updated forecasts

## Common Schema
- temperature (celsius)
- humidity (percentage)
- wind_speed (km/h)
- precipitation_probability (percentage)
- condition (enum: clear, cloudy, rain, snow, thunderstorm, fog)
- confidence (0.0-1.0)

## Rate Limiting
OpenWeatherMap: 1000 calls/day (free tier)
WeatherAPI: 1M calls/month (free tier)
NOAA: No hard limit but courtesy limit of 5 req/sec

Redis-based rate limiter tracks per-provider call counts with sliding window.

# Provider Accuracy Comparison

## Methodology
We compared 30-day forecasts against actual recorded weather for 50 US cities over 6 months.

## Results
- OpenWeatherMap: Best for temperature accuracy (RMSE 1.2C for 24h forecast)
- WeatherAPI: Best for precipitation prediction (82% accuracy for rain/no-rain)
- NOAA: Best for severe weather alerts (98% detection rate for storms)

## Confidence Weighting
Based on these results, our merge engine weights providers differently per metric:
- Temperature: OWM 0.5, WA 0.3, NOAA 0.2
- Precipitation: WA 0.5, NOAA 0.3, OWM 0.2
- Wind: NOAA 0.5, OWM 0.3, WA 0.2

Weights are configurable per region and updated quarterly based on ongoing accuracy tracking.

name: Recipe Manager
description: Personal recipe management app with ingredient parsing, meal planning, grocery list generation, and collaborative filtering-based recipe recommendations.
prompt_template: You are a culinary and software development assistant. Use the project docs to understand the recipe data model, ingredient parsing logic, and recommendation engine. Help with recipe organization, meal planning algorithms, and improving the ingredient parser.

docs.content:
# Ingredient Parser Design

## Challenge
Parsing ingredient strings like '2 cups all-purpose flour, sifted' into structured data:
- quantity: 2
- unit: cups
- ingredient: all-purpose flour
- preparation: sifted

## Approach
Three-stage pipeline:
1. Tokenization: Split on commas and parentheses to separate prep notes
2. Quantity extraction: Regex for numbers, fractions (1/2), unicode fractions, ranges (2-3)
3. Unit matching: Dictionary of 50+ unit aliases (tbsp, tablespoon, T, tbs)
4. Ingredient identification: Remaining tokens after quantity and unit removal

## Edge Cases
- 'Salt to taste' (no quantity)
- '1 (14.5 oz) can diced tomatoes' (nested units)
- 'Juice of 2 lemons' (quantity applies to source, not juice)
- '2-3 cloves garlic, minced' (range quantities)

## Accuracy
Current parser handles 89% of test cases correctly. Most failures are on compound ingredients and unusual unit formats.

name: Fitness Tracker
description: React Native mobile app for workout logging, GPS route tracking, training plan generation, and fitness analytics with Apple HealthKit and Google Fit integration.
prompt_template: You are a fitness and mobile development expert. Use the project docs to understand the workout data model, GPS tracking implementation, and training plan algorithms. Help with performance optimization, health data integration, and training plan generation.

docs.content:
# GPS Tracking Implementation Notes

## Battery Optimization
Continuous high-accuracy GPS (kCLLocationAccuracyBest) drains ~15% battery per hour.
Our adaptive sampling strategy:
- Steady pace: Sample every 10 seconds
- Speed change detected: Increase to every 3 seconds
- Stopped (< 0.5 m/s for 30s): Pause GPS, use accelerometer to detect movement resume
- Result: ~7% battery per hour (53% reduction)

## Route Smoothing
Raw GPS points have noise of 5-15 meters in urban areas.
We apply a Kalman filter for real-time smoothing and use the Douglas-Peucker algorithm for storage optimization (reduces point count by ~70% with < 2m deviation).

## Background Tracking (iOS)
Requires 'location' background mode capability and 'Always' location permission.
Using CLLocationManager with allowsBackgroundLocationUpdates = true.
Must show blue status bar indicator per Apple guidelines.
Handling app termination: Register for significant location change monitoring as fallback.

name: Book Club App
description: Web application for organizing virtual book clubs with reading progress tracking, discussion scheduling, and collaborative annotations on shared book passages.
prompt_template: You are a literature and web development assistant. Help with book club management features, reading progress algorithms, and discussion facilitation tools. Use the project docs for data model and feature specifications.

docs.content:
# Book Club App Feature Spec

## Core Features
1. Club Management: Create/join clubs, invite members, set reading schedules
2. Book Selection: Nominate books, vote on next reads, track reading history
3. Progress Tracking: Log pages read, set daily/weekly goals, view club-wide progress
4. Discussions: Threaded comments on chapters, spoiler tags, scheduled discussion events
5. Annotations: Highlight passages, share notes, see other members' highlights

## Reading Pace Algorithm
Calculates suggested daily page count based on:
- Book length and club deadline
- Member's historical reading speed (pages/hour from past books)
- Buffer days for catching up (configurable, default 2 days before discussion)
- Adjusts dynamically as member logs progress

## Data Model
- clubs (id, name, description, created_by, created_at)
- club_members (club_id, user_id, role, joined_at)
- books (id, title, author, page_count, isbn, cover_url)
- reading_sessions (id, user_id, book_id, pages_read, duration_minutes, logged_at)
- discussions (id, club_id, book_id, chapter, title, scheduled_at)
- comments (id, discussion_id, user_id, content, parent_id, created_at)
- annotations (id, user_id, book_id, page, start_char, end_char, note, shared)

name: Garden Planner
description: Mobile-friendly web app for planning vegetable gardens with companion planting suggestions, seasonal calendars, frost date tracking, and harvest logging.
prompt_template: You are a gardening and horticulture expert with web development skills. Use the project docs for companion planting data, frost date calculations, and garden layout algorithms. Help plan gardens, suggest planting schedules, and troubleshoot plant health issues.

docs.content:
# Companion Planting Database

## Beneficial Pairings
- Tomatoes + Basil: Basil repels aphids and whiteflies, may improve tomato flavor
- Carrots + Onions: Onion scent deters carrot fly, carrots repel onion fly
- Corn + Beans + Squash (Three Sisters): Corn provides bean trellis, beans fix nitrogen, squash shades soil
- Lettuce + Tall plants: Lettuce benefits from partial shade in summer
- Marigolds + Most vegetables: Repel nematodes and many pest insects

## Antagonistic Pairings (avoid)
- Tomatoes + Brassicas: Tomatoes inhibit brassica growth
- Fennel + Most plants: Fennel inhibits growth of nearby plants
- Potatoes + Tomatoes: Share blight susceptibility
- Onions + Beans/Peas: Onions inhibit legume growth

## Planting Calendar (Zone 8b - Portland, OR)
- Last frost: March 15 (average)
- First frost: November 15 (average)
- Indoor seed starting: 6-8 weeks before last frost (Jan 15 - Feb 1)
- Direct sow cool crops: March 1 - April 15
- Direct sow warm crops: May 1 - June 15
- Fall planting: August 1 - September 15
